messages.message: Recently found this article on NYT’s experience upgrading to React 18 (https://open.nytimes.com/enhancing-the-new-york-times-web-performance-with-react-18-d6f91a7c5af8). Seems like a solid performance improvement!

exciting!! i don’t think we have the same embedded scripts issue, so maybe our upgrade would be even smoother?

i guess they just skipped past the dependency upgrading and consequent refactoring in the blog post though :lolcry:

We shouldn’t need to worry about anything SSR-related at least for AI Hub.
And for Pollen when I worked on a draft PR for the upgrade the main conflicts were type changes (`React.FC` no longer includes `children` by default which is good) & strange interactions with d3 chart animations
